violations_detected.title: Echo method not used
violations_detected.evidence: Contact data (name and city) collected without explicit echo confirmation: customer introduces himself as 'Алексей' and gives city 'Из Санкт-Петербурга', operator only repeats 'Санкт-Петербург' without asking 'Верно?' or similar and without getting an explicit confirmation.

violations_detected.title: Long information search (flag only)
violations_detected.evidence: Operator announces search 'Сейчас посмотрю. Минуту, пожалуйста.' at ~1:13 and returns with 'Да, есть...' at ~1:57, total search duration ≈44.3s, which falls in the 40–45s flag window (no score reduction).

coaching_priorities.issue: Echo method not used for contact data (name and city).
coaching_priorities.recommendation: When collecting any contact details (name, city, phone, address), repeat them back and ask an explicit confirmation question such as 'Из Санкт-Петербурга, верно?' or 'Алексей, правильно записала?', and wait for the customer to confirm before proceeding.

coaching_priorities.issue: Information search duration close to 45-second threshold.
coaching_priorities.recommendation: Keep information searches under 40 seconds where possible, and if a search takes longer, consider giving interim updates more often and preparing key data in advance to avoid long silent pauses.

7.1.evidence: Greeting includes company and operator name and closing includes 'Чем-то ещё могу помочь?' and 'До свидания', with no obvious script violations visible in transcript.
7.1.note: Project-specific script details not available; assessment based on generic rules.

7.2.evidence: Customer provides name and city, but operator does not perform full echo method (no repeat+confirmation question+explicit confirmation).
7.2.note: See violations_detected entry for detailed timestamps.

7.3.evidence: First operator phrase starts at ~0.01s (<5s) and call ends immediately after final farewell, with no >5s idle period before disconnect.

7.4.evidence: Transcript shows no clear cases of the operator cutting off the customer; no 'извините, что перебиваю' phrases and no obvious abrupt interruptions in text.
7.4.note: Overlap cannot be fully assessed without multi-speaker timing or audio.

6.1.evidence: No >45s silence leading to customer hangup; the only long pause (~44s) is a search after which the operator returns and continues the conversation.

9.1.evidence: Single information search lasts ≈44.3s (1:13.380–1:57.713), within the 40–45s flag window.
9.1.note: Flagged for improvement only; does not reduce final grade.

9.3.evidence: Operator says 'Спасибо за ожидание' immediately after completing the search.

3.1.evidence: Customer receives full information about availability, condition, price and delivery; he declines due to tire condition and plans to search further or call back.
3.1.note: No clear unanswered question or neglected request from the operator side.

3.3.evidence: No internal phone numbers, passwords or third-party personal data disclosed; only standard product, price and delivery information discussed.

3.6.evidence: Key factual information about the tire (availability, condition, price, delivery date) is provided after an explicit system search.
3.6.note: Cannot fully verify project 'strict script' requirements from transcript alone.

5.1.evidence: Customer receives price, delivery cost and approximate delivery timing; no explicit request for additional mandatory details is left unanswered.
5.1.note: Evaluation is partial because project-specific list of mandatory information is not available.

10.2.evidence: Call follows a clear structure: greeting, clarifying needs (city, size), search, result explanation, discussion of options and closing.

10.3.evidence: Operator stays polite, listens to customer concerns about tire condition, offers reservation and alternative options, and closes with 'Чем-то ещё могу помочь?'.
10.3.note: Customer name is not reused in dialogue but overall dialogue management remains good.

10.6.evidence: Operator gives accurate information about tire model, discount reason, price, payment options and indicative delivery date.
10.6.note: Some project-specific details (e.g., full logistics policy) are outside transcript scope.

2.1.evidence: Call ends with mutual farewell after customer says 'Нет, спасибо, до свидания'; no unexpected dropout or unjustified refusal of service.

1.1.evidence: No profanity or explicitly rude phrases from the operator in the transcript; tone appears polite throughout.
1.1.note: Tone and volume cannot be fully assessed without audio.

4.1.evidence: Customer expresses doubts and some frustration about buying a discounted tire, while operator remains calm, explains risks and options, and closes politely.
4.1.note: Assessment based on text only; prosody and emotional tone not available.

positive_observations: Professional greeting with company and operator name.
Clarifies city and tire size before searching, ensuring request is understood.
Explains discounted tire condition (previous mounting and minor imbalance) in understandable terms.
Offers to reserve the tire and consult specialists, and suggests alternative options.
Ends the call with an offer of additional help and polite farewell.

data_quality.confidence_notes: Word-level JSON marks all sentences as speaker 'A', so speaker roles were inferred from context; minor recognition issues on brand names but overall transcript is reliable.
